revision.comment: cleanup
revision.text: {{Documentation subpage}} __NOTOC__ ===Purpose=== Determines whether something is valid in a certain context. Currently only implemented for determining if a number is within the precision that Wikibooks expressions can handle. ===Returns=== '''true''' if the argument is valid, '''false''' if it is not. ===Examples=== :{{valid|number=A}} = {{valid|number=A}} ''(not a number)'' :{{valid|number=1234}} = {{valid|number=1234}} :{{valid|number=+1234}} = {{valid|number=+1234}} :{{valid|number=-1234}} = {{valid|number=-1234}} :{{valid|number=(1234)}} = {{valid|number=(1234)}} ''(one pair of parenthesis is allowed)'' :{{valid|number=--1234}} = {{valid|number=--1234}} ''(incorrect sign use)'' :{{valid|number=1234567890}} = {{valid|number=1234567890}} :{{valid|number=12345678901234567890}} = {{valid|number=12345678901234567890}} ''(too large)'' :{{valid|number=1.234567890}} = {{valid|number=1.234567890}} :{{valid|number=1.2345678901234567890}} = {{valid|number=1.2345678901234567890}} ''(too many decimals)'' ===Performance impact=== Template:Valid returns "true" for a valid, single number (2+2 gives "false"), and allows [[w:scientific notation|scientific notation]] (such as: -3.45E-07). The precision limit is determined live, for whichever server is formatting the page, typically allowing 14-digit precision (plus trailing zeroes), but it does not detect extreme precision problems dropping minor end-digits: :* cannot reject: -10020030040050000000000000000.70, treated as -1.002003004005E+28 The template has been written with minimal markup text, and could be used 50,000-13,000 times per page, or less when all 30-digit numbers. Template:Valid is typically used at upper levels of other templates, so it is unlikely to trigger expansion-depth problems. However, it has an [[m:Help:Expansion depth|expansion-depth]] of 8 levels, and returns "false" if used when nested too deep inside other templates, such as at level 33 when the expansion depth limit is 40. [[Category:Function templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.comment: cleanup
revision.text: {{Documentation subpage}} === Purpose === '''EVAL'''uate, but '''N'''o '''S'''cientific notation. This template can be used to evaluate an expression, if the result has to be suitable as input for further expressions. === Returns === If the output is not valid as input, the expression is just reproduced, enclosed in parentheses. Otherwise it returns the number returned in the evaluation of the specified expression. So this template just has the same effect as calling {{#expr: ...}} directly, except that parentheses will appear around the source expression if that expression cannot be evaluated (for example a missing parameter value without a default), avoiding the error message generated by {{#expr: ...}}. * {{evalns|1 + {{evalns|1234567890*{{{missingparameter}}}*1234567890}}}} gives {{evalns|1 + {{evalns|1234567890*{{{missingparameter}}}*1234567890}}}}. * {{#expr:1 + {{#expr:1234567890*{{{missingparameter}}}*1234567890}}}} gives Expression error: Unexpected < operator. === Examples === * {{evalns|3*4}} gives {{evalns|3*4}}. * {{evalns|1234567890*12}} gives {{evalns|1234567890*12}}. * {{evalns|1234567890*1234567890}} gives {{evalns|1234567890*1234567890}}. Note: the scientific notation of result numbers are no longer a problem when these results are further inserted in other expressions. So this version no longer invalidates numbers in scientific notations, as they are directly evaluatable. The protection of parentheses is not even needed, due to numeric operator precedences for the "e" operator (which multiplies a number by a power of 10 given by a (possibly negative) number in its second operand: * {{evalns|1 + {{evalns|1234567890*1234567890}}}} gives {{evalns|1 + {{evalns|1234567890*1234567890}}}}. * {{evalns|{{evalns|1234567890*1234567890}} + 1}} gives {{evalns|{{evalns|1234567890*1234567890}} + 1}}. * {{evalns|2 * {{evalns|1234567890*1234567890}}}} gives {{evalns|2 * {{evalns|1234567890*1234567890}}}}. * {{evalns|{{evalns|1234567890*1234567890}} + 1}} gives {{evalns|{{evalns|1234567890*1234567890}} * 2}}. Using {{#expr: ...}} directly produces the same result : * {{#expr:1 + {{#expr:1234567890*1234567890}}}} gives {{#expr:1 + {{#expr:1234567890*1234567890}}}}. * {{#expr:{{#expr:1234567890*1234567890}} + 1}} gives {{#expr:{{#expr:1234567890*1234567890}} + 1}}. * {{#expr:2 * {{#expr:1234567890*1234567890}}}} gives {{#expr:2 * {{#expr:1234567890*1234567890}}}}. * {{#expr:{{#expr:1234567890*1234567890}} + 1}} gives {{#expr:{{#expr:1234567890*1234567890}} * 2}}. === Source code === (simplified and formatted, removing the "subst" parameter stuff which is also included) {{#if: {{#ifexpr: {{#expr: {{{1}}} }} }} | ({{{1}}}) | {{#expr: {{{1}}} }} }} This first tries to evaluate the expression, which may return either a number, or a special value like INF or NAN, or an error message. Then the #ifexpr reevaluates this string : only numbers will pass, but as there's no return expression, an empty string will be returned ; if there's an evaluation error (including when evaluating INF or NAN values), only an error message will be regenerated. Finally the #if just test for the presence or not of the error message. If there's one, the parameter 1 could not be evaluated to a finite number, so the parameter is returned between parentheses ; otherwise, the parameter is reevaluted to return its value Note that if the expression in parameter 1 is just a simple number, it will be with those zeroes stripped, and exponents will be normalized : "{{#expr:1.50}}" = "{{#expr:1.50}}", "{{#expr:.00001}}" = "{{#expr:.00001}}". Numbers are returned with at most 13 significant digits, either as integers or fractional numbers if possible, but using normalized the exponential notation for all numbers whose absolute value is lower than {{#expr:1E-4}} or higher than or equal to {{#expr:1E15}}. [[Category:Mathematical function templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.text: <includeonly>{{scinote/{{#if:{{{2|}}}|S|P}}{{{fn|}}}{{#expr:({{{1}}}>0)-({{{1}}}<0)}}|{{{1}}}|{{#expr:floor(ln(abs{{{1}}})/ln10)}}|{{{2}}}}}</includeonly><noinclude>{{doc}} </noinclude>

revision.comment: cleanup
revision.text: {{Documentation subpage}} ===Usage=== This template converts a decimal expression into scientific notation. :e.g. {{scinote|12345}} gives "{{scinote|12345}}" To round to a given number of significant figures, specify this number as the second unnamed parameter. :e.g. {{scinote|12345|3}} gives "{{scinote|12345|3}}" For engineering notation set fn=eng. :e.g. {{scinote|12345|fn=eng}} gives "{{scinote|12345|fn=eng}}" Trailing zeros are preserved. :e.g. {{scinote|0.001234500}} gives "{{scinote|0.001234500}}" ===See also=== *{{tl|e}} [[Category:mathematical function templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.comment: cleanup
revision.text: <includeonly>{{scinote/e|{{rnd|({{{1}}}*10^-{{{2}}})|{{#expr:{{precision|{{{1}}}}}+{{{2}}}}}}}|{{{2}}}}}</includeonly><noinclude>[[Category:Template subpages|{{PAGENAME}}]]</noinclude>

revision.comment: formatting
revision.text: {{{1}}}×10^{{#ifexpr:{{{2}}}<0|−{{#expr:-{{{2}}}}}|{{{2}}}}}{{documentation|content= This subtemplate gives ''a''×10''b'' where ''a'' and ''b'' are given by unnamed parameters {{{1}}} and {{{2}}} respectively. {{{2}}} must be numerical, negative values are displayed with a proper minus sign. The multiplication sign is spaced with thin non-breaking spaces. Example: *{{scinote/e|2|3}} → {{scinote/e|2|3}} Compare {{tl|e}}: *{{e|3}} → {{e|3}} }} [[Category:Template subpages|{{PAGENAME}}]]

}}

</noinclude>

revision.text:
<includeonly>{{scinote/e|{{rnd/-|{{#expr:{{{1}}}/10^{{{2}}}}}|{{#expr:{{{3}}}-1}}}}|{{{2}}}}}</includeonly><noinclude>{{documentation|content=This subtemplate calls {{tl|scinote/e}} to display {{{1}}}×10<sup>{{{2}}}</sup>, adding trailing zeros such that there are at least {{{3}}} − 1 significant figures after the decimal point (limited to twelve) using {{tl|rnd/-}}.
}}
[[Category:Template subpages|{{PAGENAME}}]]
</noinclude>

Welcome!
revision.text:
[[Wikibooks:Welcome|Welcome]] to Wikibooks, H.R.Silas!
[[File:Crystal Clear app kedit.png|20px|link=|alt=]] '''First steps tutorial'''
'''Wikibooks is for [[WB:AGF|collaborative]] development of free [[WB:WIW|textbooks]].''' You do not need technical skills to [[Using Wikibooks|contribute]]. You can [[WB:BOLD|easily change most books]]. Please [[WB:CHAT|introduce yourself]], and let us know what [[WB:PROJECTS|interests you]]. If you already contribute at other Wikimedia projects, our [[Wikibooks:Wikibooks for Wikimedians|Wikimedia Orientation]] should quickly get you started.
(Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?)
[[File:Icon apps query.svg|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Getting help'''
* Read the [[Using Wikibooks]] book for a friendly introduction to the project, or our [[Help:Contents|help pages]] for more information. * You can get friendly help from the community in the [[WB:HELP|user assistance room]] or our [[irc:wikibooks|IRC channel]]. * Upload freely licensed files to [[commons:Wikimedia Commons|Wikimedia Commons]]. You may [[WB:RFP|request permission]] to upload [[w:fair use|fair use]] files locally. Please include author and source {{tl|information}} and a {{nowrap|{{tl|non-free use rationale}}}} for [[WB:FU|non-free]] files.
[[File:Nuvola filesystems trashcan full.png|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Made a mistake?'''
* You can [[WB:REVERT|restore]] a previously saved version. * Pages should follow the [[WB:NP|'''Book Title/Chapter Title''']] naming convention. * Need to rename a page? Use the ''move'' tab (is available once your account is 4 days old - until then, ask for [[WB:HELP|help]]). * To request a page be deleted, add {{tlx|delete|''your reason''}} to the top of the page. * Was a page you made deleted? Please read the [[WB:DP|deletion policy]], and check the [[Special:Log/delete|deletion log]] to find out why. Also check the [[WB:RFD|RFD]] archives if applicable. You can request undeletion at [[WB:RFU]], or ask the administrator who deleted the page.
[[File:Transmission icon.png|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Goodies, tips and tricks'''
* Please fill in [[WB:ES|the edit summary]] and [[WB:PREVIEW|preview]] your edits before saving. * Sign your name on [[WB:TALK|discussion pages]] by typing ~~~~ * User scripts can make many tasks easier. Look at the ''Gadgets'' tab of [[Special:Preferences|''my preferences'']]; check off the boxes for the scripts you want, and hit ''save''!

Please include author and source {{tl|information}} and a {{nowrap|{{tl|non-free use rationale}}}} for [[WB:FU|non-free]] files.
[[File:Nuvola filesystems trashcan full.png|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Made a mistake?'''
* You can [[WB:REVERT|restore]] a previously saved version. * Pages should follow the [[WB:NP|'''Book Title/Chapter Title''']] naming convention. * Need to rename a page? Use the ''move'' tab (is available once your account is 4 days old - until then, ask for [[WB:HELP|help]]). * To request a page be deleted, add {{tlx|delete|''your reason''}} to the top of the page. * Was a page you made deleted? Please read the [[WB:DP|deletion policy]], and check the [[Special:Log/delete|deletion log]] to find out why. Also check the [[WB:RFD|RFD]] archives if applicable. You can request undeletion at [[WB:RFU]], or ask the administrator who deleted the page.
[[File:Transmission icon.png|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Goodies, tips and tricks'''
* Please fill in [[WB:ES|the edit summary]] and [[WB:PREVIEW|preview]] your edits before saving. * Sign your name on [[WB:TALK|discussion pages]] by typing ~~~~ * User scripts can make many tasks easier. Look at the ''Gadgets'' tab of [[Special:Preferences|''my preferences'']]; check off the boxes for the scripts you want, and hit ''save''!

revision.comment: Protected "[[Template:Rnd/e+]]": Uses complex features of wiki syntax (‎[edit=sysop] (indefinite) ‎[move=sysop] (indefinite))
revision.text: {{rnd/-|{{{1}}}E-{{{3}}}|{{#expr:{{{2}}}+{{{3}}}}}}}×10{{{3}}}{{documentation}}

revision.comment: cleanup
revision.text: {{Documentation subpage}} This is a subtemplate of {{tl|rnd}}. It displays large numbers using scientific notation. It takes three parameters. #the number to be displayed #the precision to which it is to be displayed to #the order of magnitude It calls {{tl|rnd/-}} with as parameters the significand and the number of decimals of the significand to be displayed, to add trailing zeros. <includeonly>[[Category:Template subpages|{{PAGENAME}}]]</includeonly>

revision.comment: redirect
revision.text: #REDIRECT [[Template talk:Rnd]]

revision.comment: Protected "[[Template:Rnd/e−]]": High-impact page (‎[edit=sysop] (indefinite) ‎[move=sysop] (indefinite))
revision.text: {{rnd/-|{{{1}}}E-{{{3}}}|{{#expr:{{{2}}}+{{{3}}}}}}}×10−{{#expr:-{{{3}}}}}{{documentation}}

revision.comment: cleanup
revision.text: {{Documentation subpage}} This is a subtemplate of {{tl|rnd}}. It displays small numbers using scientific notation. It takes three parameters. #the number to be displayed #the precision to which it is to be displayed to #the order of magnitude It calls {{tl|rnd/-}} with as parameters the significand and the number of decimals of the significand to be displayed, to add trailing zeros. <includeonly> [[Category:Template subpages|{{PAGENAME}}]] </includeonly>

[[File:Icon apps query.svg|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Getting help'''
* Read the [[Using Wikibooks]] book for a friendly introduction to the project, or our [[Help:Contents|help pages]] for more information. * You can get friendly help from the community in the [[WB:HELP|user assistance room]] or our [[irc:wikibooks|IRC channel]]. * Upload freely licensed files to [[commons:Wikimedia Commons|Wikimedia Commons]]. You may [[WB:RFP|request permission]] to upload [[w:fair use|fair use]] files locally. Please include author and source {{tl|information}} and a {{nowrap|{{tl|non-free use rationale}}}} for [[WB:FU|non-free]] files.
[[File:Nuvola filesystems trashcan full.png|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Made a mistake?'''
* You can [[WB:REVERT|restore]] a previously saved version. * Pages should follow the [[WB:NP|'''Book Title/Chapter Title''']] naming convention. * Need to rename a page? Use the ''move'' tab (is available once your account is 4 days old - until then, ask for [[WB:HELP|help]]). * To request a page be deleted, add {{tlx|delete|''your reason''}} to the top of the page. * Was a page you made deleted? Please read the [[WB:DP|deletion policy]], and check the [[Special:Log/delete|deletion log]] to find out why. Also check the [[WB:RFD|RFD]] archives if applicable. You can request undeletion at [[WB:RFU]], or ask the administrator who deleted the page.
[[File:Transmission icon.png|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Goodies, tips and tricks'''
* Please fill in [[WB:ES|the edit summary]] and [[WB:PREVIEW|preview]] your edits before saving. * Sign your name on [[WB:TALK|discussion pages]] by typing ~~~~ * User scripts can make many tasks easier. Look at the ''Gadgets'' tab of [[Special:Preferences|''my preferences'']]; check off the boxes for the scripts you want, and hit ''save''!

* Read the [[Using Wikibooks]] book for a friendly introduction to the project, or our [[Help:Contents|help pages]] for more information. * You can get friendly help from the community in the [[WB:HELP|user assistance room]] or our [[irc:wikibooks|IRC channel]]. * Upload freely licensed files to [[commons:Wikimedia Commons|Wikimedia Commons]]. You may [[WB:RFP|request permission]] to upload [[w:fair use|fair use]] files locally. Please include author and source {{tl|information}} and a {{nowrap|{{tl|non-free use rationale}}}} for [[WB:FU|non-free]] files.
[[File:Nuvola filesystems trashcan full.png|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Made a mistake?'''
* You can [[WB:REVERT|restore]] a previously saved version. * Pages should follow the [[WB:NP|'''Book Title/Chapter Title''']] naming convention. * Need to rename a page? Use the ''move'' tab (is available once your account is 4 days old - until then, ask for [[WB:HELP|help]]). * To request a page be deleted, add {{tlx|delete|''your reason''}} to the top of the page. * Was a page you made deleted? Please read the [[WB:DP|deletion policy]], and check the [[Special:Log/delete|deletion log]] to find out why. Also check the [[WB:RFD|RFD]] archives if applicable. You can request undeletion at [[WB:RFU]], or ask the administrator who deleted the page.
[[File:Transmission icon.png|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Goodies, tips and tricks'''
* Please fill in [[WB:ES|the edit summary]] and [[WB:PREVIEW|preview]] your edits before saving. * Sign your name on [[WB:TALK|discussion pages]] by typing ~~~~ * User scripts can make many tasks easier. Look at the ''Gadgets'' tab of [[Special:Preferences|''my preferences'']]; check off the boxes for the scripts you want, and hit ''save''!

/* Book Rename */
revision.text:
== Book Rename == You should definitely consider renaming the work. To something line Using SDL (Simple DirectMedia Layer) or Exploring SDL (Simple DirectMedia Layer). --[[User:Panic2k4|Panic]] ([[User talk:Panic2k4|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Panic2k4|contribs]]) 22:06, 7 May 2012 (UTC)
How do I go about renaming the wikibook? I have searched the help pages and only found username rename. Thanks.
[[User:Robhilly|Robhilly]] ([[User talk:Robhilly|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Robhilly|contribs]]) 21:23, 9 May 2012 (UTC)
:Use page move do not include the "(Simple DirectMedia Layer)" you can add that to the title later (see the title as a file/directory name). I had a similar problem with the [[The World of Peer-to-Peer (P2P)]] I later regretted the name choice but there were already too many subpages. :You can provide the root/cover page the full text using <nowiki>{{DISPLAYTITLE|<title>}}</nowiki>. For instance the first page may use Simple DirectMedia Layer and the rest SDL. (See the source of the p2p book for usage if you have a problem) :This means that if you use something like "Exploring SLD" you can still make the title page read "Explore the Simple DirectMedia Layer" or variations, subpages will still use the Exploring SLD/Page Name path the reverse would imply using the longer file path name... :In any case it it your choice. --[[User:Panic2k4|Panic]] ([[User talk:Panic2k4|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Panic2k4|contribs]]) 23:10, 9 May 2012 (UTC)

Recursion in programs involves calling up the program to run again from the beginning. If not done carefully it can create infinite loops of code that won't terminate. If you run a program that gets stuck in a loop you can press the On button; the On button terminates execution of any program. ==How to do it== Writing code that does is simple, within the program you simply have a call to the current program. The syntax is PRGM:EXEC then whatever program. {{bcode:Syntax| PROGRAM:TEMP ://code ://code :pgrmTEMP }} If you use recursion you always want to have some condition that has to be met in order for the recursive call to happen. An easy way to do this is to encapsulate the recursive call in an "If" statement or a while loop. ==Example== In this example we will write a simple counting program. Before we run this program we have to set X to a number, for this example we will assume it has been set to 0. {{TIB:Program|COUNT| :While X≤3 :Disp X :X+1->X :prgmCOUNT (Note: End is not needed here since the while already loops) | 0 1 2 3 }} {{BottomNav|Graph Databases|}}

revision.text: <noinclude><!-- --============================================================ -- Display a number, with optional fraction part: 6+3/8 --============================================================ -- (see NOTES at bottom) -- --></noinclude>{{#if:{{#titleparts:{{{1|-1200-3~118}}}|1|2}} |{{Convert/numdisp/frac |{{{1|-1200-3/118}}}|{{#titleparts:{{{1|-1200-3/118}}}|1|1}}|{{#titleparts:{{{1|-1200-3/118}}}|1|2}}}}<!--split at "/" --else-->|{{#ifexpr:{{{1|-14000.00}}} < 0 |<!--then re-build negative number (see NOTE Z4 below) -->{{formatnum: {{padright:−<!--&minus-->{{#expr:-{{{1|-14000.00}}} }}<!--endexpr --put decimal if needed-->{{ #ifexpr:{{{1|-14000.00}}}0={{{1|-14000.00}}} and {{{1|-14000.00}}}=floor( {{{1|-14000.00}}} )|.}}<!-- -->|{{strlen_short|{{{1|-14000.00}}}|}}<!--endstrlen_short -->|0}}<!--endpadright end-zeroes "0" to original length -->}}<!--endformatnum else-->|{{formatnum: {{{1|6000.500}}} }}}}<!--endif {1}<0 -->}}<noinclude><!--endif {#titleparts..} -------------------------------------------------------------- --NOTES: -- [ These comments are skipped by <noinclude> and not sent -- in formatted Internet pages, only during edit. ] -- --NOTE A1: This template processes a number, for display, by -- checking to display a fraction part ("/"), else it -- will check for negative to display a unicode &minus -- and {{formatnum:{{#expr:abs( {{{1|-6000}}} )}}}} such -- as "-6000" with a full minus sign rather than hyphen. -- In 99% of Wikipedia usage, there are no fractions. -- --NOTE D2: The check, for fraction parts, uses parser-function -- #titleparts to split the number at "/" (if any) and -- then checks part 2 (the denominator, after the slash) -- to trigger use of {{Convert/numdisp/fracparts}}. Hence, -- #if: {{#titleparts:{{{1|6+3/8}}}|1|2}} -- will be true if a denominator exists (such as "8"). -- --NOTE N3: This template uses minimal expansion depth of the -- if-else logic by checking for "/" before invoking the -- nested subtemplate {{Convert/numdisp/fracparts}}. The -- check for a negative number increases the nesting depth -- by 1 level to apply abs({1}) in a nested {#expr:} parser -- function, to use the absolute value of the amount {1}. -- --NOTE Z4: Any end-zeroes on a decimal are preserved by not -- using positive amounts in an expression, and for rare -- negative amounts, the &minus with inverse -{1} is padded -- by {padright:} with end-zeroes "0" to {strlen_short} but -- uses #ifexpr:{1}0={1} and floor({1})={1} to put ".". -- So, {strlen_short} keeps minimal expansion depth of +2. -- -- WARNING: *** DO NOT DELETE COMMENTS FROM THIS TEMPLATE *** -- Unless these comments are readily available, people -- might tinker with the coding (or rename templates), -- in hopes to clarify operation because these comments -- were not nearby to explain the issues. Having these -- comments only on a doc-page increases the danger of -- explanations no longer matching the current coding. -- UPDATE these comments to match changes to the template. -- UPDATE the HISTORY during major changes (not typos). -- -------------------------------------------------------------- --HISTORY: --03Apr09 Created by [[User:Jimp]] on English Wikipedia. --19Nov10 Invokes subtemplate only if has denominator (at "/"). --19Nov10 Put NOTES comments to explain template coding. --19Nov10 Put HISTORY comments to log major changes. --19Nov10 Put all parameters on 1 line to avoid newline "2^ /3" --20Nov10 Linked {Documentation} to hold any interwiki links. --12Feb11 Shows Unicode &minus ("−") for negative numbers. --17Feb11 Used {padright:} to re-add end-zeroes on negatives. --17Feb11 Used #ifexpr:{1}0={1} and floor({1})={1}, to put "." -- ** Add interwiki links to /doc subpage to avoid changes here ** -- -->{{Documentation}} </noinclude>

revision.comment: wording
revision.text: {{documentation subpage}} '''[[Template:Convert/numdisp]]''' processes a number, for display, by checking to display a fraction part (at "/"), else it just uses [[mw:Help:Extension:ParserFunctions|parser-function]] {{formatnum:{{{1|6000}}}}} to add commas, such as to show "6,000". : '''Usage:'''  {{convert/numdisp|6+3/8}} → {{convert/numdisp|6+3/8}} :::{{convert/numdisp|-4-1/2}} → {{convert/numdisp|-4-1/2}} :::{{convert/numdisp|23500}} → {{convert/numdisp|23500}} :::{{convert/numdisp|2300+643/1250}} → {{convert/numdisp|2300+643/1250}} :::{{convert/numdisp|14+6/ }} → Expression error: Unexpected < operator ===Implementation=== The check, for fraction parts, uses parser-function {{#titleparts:xx/xx|1|2}} to split a number at "/" (if any, as in: 6+3/8) and then checks if part 2 (the denominator, after the slash) contains a number, to trigger use of {{tl|Convert/numdisp/frac}}). Hence, the template uses: ::: #if: {{#titleparts:{{{1|6+3/8}}}|1|2}} That if-expression will be true if a denominator exists (such as "8" in 6+3/8). ===See also=== * [[Template:Convert/numdisp/frac]] - branches by negative/0/positive fraction * [[Template:Convert/numdisp/frac1]] - displays positive fractions * [[Template:Convert/numdisp/frac-1]] - displays negative fractions * [[Template:Convert/numdisp/frac0]] - displays fractions led by 0 [[Category:Subtemplates of Template Convert|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.comment: Protected "[[Template:Convert/numdisp/frac]]": Uses complex features of wiki syntax (‎[edit=sysop] (indefinite) ‎[move=sysop] (indefinite))
revision.text:
<noinclude><!--
--============================================================ -- Process fraction parts by negative/zero/positive (-1,0,1) --============================================================
-->{{documentation|content=This subtemplate is called by {{tl|convert/numdisp}} and by {{tl|convert/and/frn1}} to process fractions according to whether the whole number part (i.e. the ''a'' in {{frac|''a''|''b''|''c''}}) is positive, negative or zero calling {{tl|convert/numdisp/frac1}}, {{tl|convert/numdisp/frac-1}} or {{tl|convert/numdisp/frac0}} respectively.}}<!--
--></noinclude>{{convert/numdisp/frac{{ #expr:( {{{2|-6-3}}}*0>0) - ( {{{2|-6-3}}}*0<0) }} |{{{2|-6-3}}}|{{#expr:{{{2|-6-3}}}*0}}|{{#expr:0*{{{2|-6-3}}}}}|{{{3|8}}}}}<noinclude><!-- -------------------------------------------------------------- --NOTES: -- [ These comments are skipped by <noinclude> and not sent -- in formatted Internet pages, only during edit. ] -- --NOTE A1: This template handles a number+fraction, for display, -- based on amount as negative/0/positive, using -1/0/1 as -- suffix: #expr:( {{{2|6+3}}}*0>0) - ( {{{2|6+3}}}*0<0) so -- positives are /frac1, zero as /frac0, negatives /frac-1 -- without using a nested if-statement to choose 1/0/-1. -- During 2009-2010 templates were restricted to if-logic -- nested within depth of only a 40-level limit. -- --NOTE P2: The parameters, as fraction parts, expect input like -- #titleparts splitting a number at "/" (slash), where -- parameter 1 - is the original number (like 6+3/8) -- parameter 2 - is left of slash (6+3) -- parameter 3 - is after slash (8) as the denominator. -- --NOTE S3: Parameters here should NOT have spaces or split on -- separate lines: {{Convert/numdisp/fracparts|0|6+3 |8}} -- would put a space after 3, as "3 /8" in the displayed -- fraction. The MediaWiki parser appends a newline ending -- a parameter when "|" is on the next line (in 2010). -- -- WARNING: *** DO NOT DELETE COMMENTS FROM THIS TEMPLATE *** -- Unless these comments are readily available, people -- might tinker with the coding (or rename templates), -- in hopes to clarify operation because these comments -- were not nearby to explain the issues. Having these -- comments only on a doc-page increases the danger of -- explanations no longer matching the current coding. -- UPDATE these comments to match changes to the template. -- UPDATE the HISTORY during major changes (not typos). -- -------------------------------------------------------------- --HISTORY: --19Nov10 Created from {{Convert/numdisp/frac}} of User:Jimp. --19Nov10 Changed for titleparts at "/" (like {2}=6+3 & {3}=8). --19Nov10 Put NOTES comments to explain template coding. --19Nov10 Put HISTORY comments to log major changes. --28Jun11 Merge back to {{Convert/numdisp/frac}} -- -- ** Add interwiki links on docpage to limit changes here ** --> [[Category:Subtemplates of Template Convert|{{PAGENAME}}]] </noinclude>

Protected "[[Template:Convert/-]]": Uses complex features of wiki syntax (‎[edit=sysop] (indefinite) ‎[move=sysop] (indefinite))
from main page
revision.text:
{{Documentation subpage}} <!-- PLEASE ADD CATEGORIES AND INTERWIKIS AT THE BOTTOM OF THIS PAGE -->
The [[Template:Convert/-]] (for ranges using "-") is invoked as the first template below {Convert}, for converting ranges such as {Convert|2|-|4|ft|m}. It immediately invokes Convert/{4}, for the input unit {4}, passing the range of input numbers as "{1}|-|{3}". Having obtained all 8 parameters, {1}|-|{3}...{8}, it sets the precision "s" from either parameter {5}, {6} or {8} (depending on whichever is the numeric round-number); otherwise, the precision is set as: <nowiki>s=(0.5)+(0{{{s}}})</nowiki>. It passes {d} down as Dual/{d} to invoke subtemplate Convert/Dual/{d} which displays the dual-range (rather than a typical single amount). For any customization, such as disp=x, the parameters {6} and {7} are passed as {5} and {6} (or null if none). <includeonly> <!-- CATEGORIES AND INTERWIKIS HERE, THANKS --> [[Category:Subtemplates of Template Convert]] </includeonly>

The [[Template:Convert/or]] (for ranges using "or") is invoked as the first template below {Convert}, for converting ranges such as {Convert|2|or|4|ft|m}. It immediately invokes Convert/{4}, for the input unit {4}, passing the range of input numbers as "{1}|or|{3}". Having obtained all 8 parameters, {1}|or|{3}...{8}, it sets the precision "s" from either parameter {5}, {6} or {8} (depending on whichever is the numeric round-number); otherwise, the precision is set as: <nowiki>s=(0.5)+(0{{{s}}})</nowiki>. It passes {d} down as Dual/{d} to invoke subtemplate Convert/Dual/{d} which displays the dual-range (rather than a typical single amount). For any customization, such as disp=x, the parameters {6} and {7} are passed as {5} and {6} (or null if none). <includeonly> <!-- CATEGORIES AND INTERWIKIS HERE, THANKS --> [[Category:Subtemplates of Template Convert]] </includeonly>

revision.comment: cleanup
revision.text:
{{Documentation subpage}} <!-- PLEASE ADD CATEGORIES AND INTERWIKIS AT THE BOTTOM OF THIS PAGE -->
The subtemplate is called by {{tl|precision}} (the main template page). This main page will have determined whether the input is in the form of a fraction or decimal/integer. *For fractional input it returns the base ten logarithm of the numerator. *Otherwise it determines whether the input is a decimal or integer and calls either {{tl|precision/1}} or {{tl|precision/0}} accordingly. <includeonly> <!-- CATEGORIES AND INTERWIKIS HERE, THANKS --> [[Category:Template subpages|{{PAGENAME}}]] </includeonly>

revision.comment: from main page
revision.text:
{{Documentation subpage}} <!-- PLEASE ADD CATEGORIES AND INTERWIKIS AT THE BOTTOM OF THIS PAGE -->
The '''[[Template:Convert/-/AonSoff]]''' displays a range of numbers with en-dash "–" and the unit symbol abbreviation (if any), else it displays the unit name, as singular or plural for the 2nd amount. An example of a unit which has no unit symbol is the unit acre, which always shows either "acre" or "acres". This template is used to show either the input range numbers or the output range numbers, which might contain commas or x10 notation. <includeonly> <!-- CATEGORIES AND INTERWIKIS HERE, THANKS --> [[Category:Subtemplates of Template Convert]] </includeonly>

revision.comment: wording
revision.text:
{{Documentation subpage}} <!-- PLEASE ADD CATEGORIES AND INTERWIKIS AT THE BOTTOM OF THIS PAGE -->
'''[[Template:Convert/-/AoffSoff]]''' displays a range of two numbers separated by an en-dash "–" followed by the unit name, as singular or plural for the 2nd amount. If the 2nd amount is a negative number, then spaces are added around the en-dash, as " – ".
This template is used to show either the input range numbers or the output range numbers, which might contain commas or x10 notation. Optional parameters {amt1} & {amt2} could be used for numeric tests of the results, as passed with formatted results {1} and {2} from {{[[Template:Convert/Dual/rnd|Convert/Dual/rnd]]}}, {{[[Template:Convert/Dual/prnd|Convert/Dual/prnd]]}}, etc. <includeonly> <!-- CATEGORIES AND INTERWIKIS HERE, THANKS --> [[Category:Subtemplates of Template Convert]] </includeonly>

revision.comment: Protected "[[Template:Max/12]]": Uses complex features of wiki syntax (‎[edit=autoconfirmed] (indefinite) ‎[move=autoconfirmed] (indefinite))
/* See also */ -link
revision.text:
{{Documentation subpage}} {{Intricate template}} Evaluates and returns the maximum of a list of up to twelve numeric values. The parameters can be numeric expressions that will be evaluated. Empty, missing, or skipped parameters are ignored. ; Syntax: : 
{{Max/12|[value1]|[value2]|etc.}}
; Examples: : {{Max/12}} = "{{Max/12}}". : {{Max/12|}} = "{{Max/12|}}". : {{Max/12|7}} = "{{Max/12|7}}". : {{Max/12|7|}} = "{{Max/12|7|}}". : {{Max/12|-5|7}} = "{{Max/12|-5|7}}". : {{Max/12|-5||||7}} = "{{Max/12|-5||||7}}". === See also === * {{tl|Max}} takes up to three optional parameters (ignores empty and non-numeric parameters) * {{tl|Max/2}} takes exactly two numeric parameters * {{tl|Max/3}} takes exactly three numeric parameters * {{tl|Max/4}} takes up to four optional parameters (ignores empty and non-numeric parameters) [[Category:Template subpages|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.text:
This is the DESCRIPTION of this manual(coming soon :)) ==Chapter 1 System Introduction== :This chapter introduces how to startup the system and describes the system interface, and also introduces the system tool bar in detail. ===System Startup=== :You can startup the system using any of the following methods: :1. Double click the InteriCAD T5 shortcut on the WINDOWS desktop. :2. Select Program from start menu, and then YFCAD Software/InteriCAD T5. ===System Interface=== :The system startup window looks as follows: [[File:My pci1.JPG|thumb|none|my pci1 disc1]] :
::[[File:My pci1.JPG|640px|gggg]] =====2D Design Interface===== : : : :*'''Menu Bar''': Where software commands are placed, you can use them by clicking the left mouse button. :*'''Tool Bar''': Where most common commands are placed, you can use them by clicking the left mouse button. :*'''Workplace''': The specific area to construct drawing. =====Introduction to Yuan Fang VR Interface===== : :*'''Menu Bar''': Where software commands are placed, you can use them by clicking the left mouse button. :*'''Tool Bar''': Where most common commands are placed, you can use them by clicking the left mouse button. :*'''Workplace''': The specific area to construct drawing. :*'''Command Window''': Where you can input commands. :*'''Status Bar''': Display cursor, coordinate and mode status. =====Modeling Design Interface===== : :*'''Menu Bar''': Where software commands are placed, you can use them by clicking the left mouse button. :*'''Tool Bar''': Where most common commands are placed, you can use them by clicking the left mouse button. :*'''Drawing Window''': The area you construct drawing. The system defaults into four-view form. The one in the left upper corner is front view, in the left lower corner is top view, in the right upper corner is side view, and in the right lower corner is isometric view. :*'''Command Window''': Where you can input command. :*'''Status Bar''': Display cursor coordinate and mode status. :*'''Construction Graph Screen Menu''': Most common Construction Graph commands. ==Chapter 2 2D Design== ===Interface=== :The interface of 2D design is shown as below: : :The interface includes: :'''Menu''': All commands can be found in menu :'''Toolbar''': Shortcut icons of main commands can be found :'''Design Wizard''': Showing the steps of design :'''Drawing space''': Where you can draw the floor plan :'''Furniture library''': includes Yuan Fang system library and manufacturer’s customized library. Left click to unfold each category and call certain piece of furniture ===Common Operation=== :*Usage of the Mouse ::'''Left click''': Most commands are accomplished by left click. For example: selecting pull-down menu, clicking icon on toolbar and etc. ::'''Right click''': Some commands are ended by right click. For any existing object, right click it and the edit command will be shown. ::Note: No matter what command is being executed, right click and the command will exit. :*Two Operation Rules ::Rule No.1: Select command first. Then follow the prompt to execute further operation. ::Rule No.2: Select object first. Then right click, and the exclusive edit menu towards the selected object will be shown. Note: every object has its unique edit menu. This menu cannot be found in the tool bar. ===File Menu=== :*New File ::Create a new drawing file. ::'''Basic operations''':Click '''''File / New''''' in menu bar. ::'''Note''': If any changes have been made to the current file, the system will ask you whether to save it. Click Yes, the system will save the file. If it is a new file, the file will be saved as a new file.Click No, the system will open a new file without saving the current file.If Cancel, the system will not open a new file. :*Open :*Save :*Save as :*Export Image :*Print :*Print Setting :*Shortcut Setting :*Exit ===Object Edit Function=== :*Select Object :*Undo :*Redo :*Move :*Rotate :*Copy :*Mirror :*Erase ===View=== :*Full Screen :*Zoom Window :*Zoom :*Pan :*Zoom In :*Zoom Out :*Hide/Show Image ===Drawing Tool=== :*Line :*Arc :*Circle :*Polyline :*Text :*Horizontal Dimension :*Aligned Dimension :*Angular Dimension :*Insert Image :*Insert Image Frame :*Insert File.. :*Free Region :*Search Region ===Room Structure=== :*Design Wizard :*Wall :*Insert Door, Window and Column :*Edit door and window :*Furniture List ===Ceiling=== :*Search Ceiling Frame :*Manual Ceiling :*Ceiling Block :*Ceiling Lights :*Linear Ceiling Lights :*Show Ceiling/Hide Ceiling ===Layout Furniture=== :*Edit the Furniture :*Furniture Set ===Setting Menu=== :*Display Mode :*Image Quality :*Unit…….. :*Snap on….. :*Setting of Snap :*Image Insert Point Setting :*Size Dimension and Style :*Default Text Color :*Default Wall Thickness :*Highlight Wall Optimize Display/]] ** [[/9.13.5 Surface Radiosity Setting/]] ==Chapter 10 Online Cloud Library== Online Cloud Library is a brand new system developped by YFCAD, aiming to provide more efficient customized modeling service to individual users.
Online Modeling Service contains 3 parts: Make Model, Check Model, and Recharge. :• Make Model. This is for submitting model information. :• Check Model. This is for checking the progress of modeling. Users can also send their feedbacks about the model to YFCAD. :• Recharge. This is for the basic cost of the service. ===Basic Operations:=== =====Part1: Make Model===== =====Part2: Check Model===== =====Part3: Recharge===== {{subjects|Business software}} {{alphabetical|I}} {{status|0%}}

== remove numbers of users and edits? ==
I have added a {{tlx|Hide in print}} template to remove the sentence about the numbers of users and edits in the print version because they were not correctly resolved when producing the PDF. Shouldn't this sentence be removed completely since the only purpose of this page is to be added to a PDF or printed book? --[[User:Martin Kraus|Martin Kraus]] ([[User talk:Martin Kraus|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Martin Kraus|contribs]]) 09:21, 8 May 2012 (UTC)
:I commented out the sentence for the reasons mentioned above. --[[User:Martin Kraus|Martin Kraus]] ([[User talk:Martin Kraus|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Martin Kraus|contribs]]) 12:29, 16 May 2012 (UTC)
== removed warning template ==
The warning template didn't print, resulting in the loss(!) of the warning message in the PDF version. I removed the template in order to have the message in the PDF version. I start to wonder whether anyone cares at all about the content of this page. ;) --[[User:Martin Kraus|Martin Kraus]] ([[User talk:Martin Kraus|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Martin Kraus|contribs]]) 09:27, 8 May 2012 (UTC)
== note to users of this page ==
I got a book from PediaPress today and noted that the following text is printed on the 2nd page (right after the title page):
:The content within this book was generated collaboratively by volunteers. Please be advised that nothing found here has necessarily been reviewed by people with the expertise required to provide you with complete, accurate or reliable information. Some information in this book may be misleading or simply wrong. PediaPress does not guarantee the validity of the information found here. If you need specific advice (for example, medical, legal, financial, or risk management) please seek a professional who is licensed or knowledgeable in that area.
:Sources, licenses and contributors of the articles and images are listed in the section entitled "References". Parts of the books may be licensed under the GNU Free Documentation License. A copy of this license is included in the section entitled "GNU Free Documentation License"
:All third-party trademarks used belong to their respective owners.
:Create your own custom Wikipedia-Book at http://pediapress.com
There is some overlap with the Collections Preface; thus, in some cases this automatically included text might be sufficient and it's unnecessary to include the Collections Preface. --[[User:Martin Kraus|Martin Kraus]] ([[User talk:Martin Kraus|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Martin Kraus|contribs]]) 12:29, 16 May 2012 (UTC)

revision.text:
== Welcome! ==
[[Wikibooks:Welcome|Welcome]] to Wikibooks, Wikienots!
[[File:Crystal Clear app kedit.png|20px|link=|alt=]] '''First steps tutorial'''
'''Wikibooks is for [[WB:AGF|collaborative]] development of free [[WB:WIW|textbooks]].''' You do not need technical skills to [[Using Wikibooks|contribute]]. You can [[WB:BOLD|easily change most books]]. Please [[WB:CHAT|introduce yourself]], and let us know what [[WB:PROJECTS|interests you]]. If you already contribute at other Wikimedia projects, our [[Wikibooks:Wikibooks for Wikimedians|Wikimedia Orientation]] should quickly get you started.
(Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?)
[[File:Icon apps query.svg|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Getting help'''
* Read the [[Using Wikibooks]] book for a friendly introduction to the project, or our [[Help:Contents|help pages]] for more information. * You can get friendly help from the community in the [[WB:HELP|user assistance room]] or our [[irc:wikibooks|IRC channel]]. * Upload freely licensed files to [[commons:Wikimedia Commons|Wikimedia Commons]]. You may [[WB:RFP|request permission]] to upload [[w:fair use|fair use]] files locally. Please include author and source {{tl|information}} and a {{nowrap|{{tl|non-free use rationale}}}} for [[WB:FU|non-free]] files.
[[File:Nuvola filesystems trashcan full.png|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Made a mistake?'''
* You can [[WB:REVERT|restore]] a previously saved version. * Pages should follow the [[WB:NP|'''Book Title/Chapter Title''']] naming convention. * Need to rename a page? Use the ''move'' tab (is available once your account is 4 days old - until then, ask for [[WB:HELP|help]]). * To request a page be deleted, add {{tlx|delete|''your reason''}} to the top of the page. * Was a page you made deleted? Please read the [[WB:DP|deletion policy]], and check the [[Special:Log/delete|deletion log]] to find out why. Also check the [[WB:RFD|RFD]] archives if applicable. You can request undeletion at [[WB:RFU]], or ask the administrator who deleted the page.
[[File:Transmission icon.png|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Goodies, tips and tricks'''
* Please fill in [[WB:ES|the edit summary]] and [[WB:PREVIEW|preview]] your edits before saving. * Sign your name on [[WB:TALK|discussion pages]] by typing ~~~~ * User scripts can make many tasks easier. Look at the ''Gadgets'' tab of [[Special:Preferences|''my preferences'']]; check off the boxes for the scripts you want, and hit ''save''!
Thanks, --[[User:QuiteUnusual|'''QU''']] [[User talk:QuiteUnusual|TalkQu]] 09:49, 8 May 2012 (UTC)
== Manual of Style == Hello, please take some time to read the help pages linked above on how to format your book. The main two points for now are that the book's chapters should be "sub pages" of the main page, not independent articles like Wikipedia is. If you look at how your book has been amended you'll see how to do this. Secondly if you want to add your book to a category this is done by adding {{tlx|subjects}} to the main book page and {{tlx|BookCat}} to the subpages - there's no need to edit the category. In particular editing the category description is problematic as you changed the purpose of the category from general purpose business software to specific to your book. No problem as it has been changed back now. Have fun. [[User:QuiteUnusual|'''QU''']] [[User talk:QuiteUnusual|TalkQu]] 09:51, 8 May 2012 (UTC) Could you try not to create links like this [[chapter name]] and instead create them like this [[/chapter name/]] when putting them on the main page of your book. If you do the former all the pages will be created in the wrong place and will need deleting by an admin - annoying for them and for you too. If this isn't clear, please ask - thanks. [[User:QuiteUnusual|'''QU''']] [[User talk:QuiteUnusual|TalkQu]] 15:28, 8 May 2012 (UTC) Okay, I've see you've chosen to ignore me again. If you persist with your approach and create pages named as per the red links in your main page they will be deleted. Financial pressure Board of Trustees saw how much $ Joe Paterno brought it

Beth- Financial/ Reputation and Background Lauren- Paterno and Bystander affect Sean- Accountability

page.title: Talk:The Devonshire Manuscript/Also wyckyd tonges byn so prest

revision.comment: changed link to new HCMC scraper space
revision.text:
== Contributors ==
To see a visualization of editor contributions to this page, click [http://hcmc.uvic.ca/~etcl/scraper/pages/Also_wyckyd_tonges_b_264102.htm here]. [[User:Cultures4|Cultures4]] ([[User talk:Cultures4|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Cultures4|contribs]]) 16:50, 8 May 2012 (UTC)
== Context ==
The commentary for this poem would benefit from further description and critical context. See, for example, [[The_Devonshire_Manuscript/Works_Cited_A-M#H|Elizabeth Heale. "'Desiring Women Writing': Female Voices and Courtly 'Balets' in Some Early Tudor Manuscript Albums". ''Early Modern Women's Manuscript Writing: Selected Papers from the Trinity/Trent Colloquium''. Aldershot: Ashgate, 2004. 9-31]] and [[The_Devonshire_Manuscript/Works_Cited_A-M#H|Elizabeth Heale. "Misogyny and the Complete Gentleman in Early Elizabethan Printed Miscellanies". ''Yearbook of English Studies'' 33 (2003): 233-247]]. [[User:Cultures4|Cultures4]] ([[User talk:Cultures4|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Cultures4|contribs]]) 19:45, 22 May 2012 (UTC)

page.title: Talk:The Devonshire Manuscript/Cruell desire my master and my foo

revision.comment: changed link to new HCMC scraper space
revision.text: == Contributors == To see a visualization of editor contributions to this page, click [http://hcmc.uvic.ca/~etcl/scraper/pages/Cruell_desire_my_mas_263874.htm here]. [[User:Cultures4|Cultures4]] ([[User talk:Cultures4|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Cultures4|contribs]]) 17:03, 8 May 2012 (UTC) == Context == The commentary for this poem would benefit from further description and critical context, particularly in regard to Wyatt's revision process. See, for example, Hallett Smith. "The Art of Sir Thomas Wyatt." ''Huntington Library Quarterly'' 9.4 (1946): 323-55 and D.R. Carlson. "The Henrician Courtier Writing in Manuscript and Print: Wyatt, Surrey, Bryan, and Others." ''A Companion to Tudor Literature''. Ed. Kent Cartwright. Oxford: Wiley-Blackwell, 2010. 151-77. [[User:Cultures4|Cultures4]] ([[User talk:Cultures4|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Cultures4|contribs]]) 18:56, 22 May 2012 (UTC) == Oddly shaped 'd' in line 3 == Isn't the 'd' in line 3 ("that I have sought dothe chase me to & froo") oddly shaped? Perhaps it was adapted from an accidental 'b'? [[User:Cultures33|Cultures33]] ([[User talk:Cultures33|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Cultures33|contribs]]) 17:01, 17 July 2012 (UTC)

page.title: Talk:The Devonshire Manuscript/Eche man telles me I chaunge of my devise

revision.comment: changed link to new HCMC scraper space
revision.text:
== Contributors == To see a visualization of editor contributions to this page, click [http://hcmc.uvic.ca/~etcl/scraper/pages/Eche_man_telles_me_I_264031.htm here]. [[User:Cultures4|Cultures4]] ([[User talk:Cultures4|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Cultures4|contribs]]) 17:19, 8 May 2012 (UTC) == Line 2 character query == Is this an instance of an 'o' and a macron forming a word?
"on my faithe me think it good reson" [[User:Cultures33|Cultures33]] ([[User talk:Cultures33|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Cultures33|contribs]]) 16:44, 17 July 2012 (UTC) == Ascending curl in line 6 == In line 6, the ascending curl appears to supply an omitted 'i,' and, taken with the visible 'on,' completes the 'ion' ending. Is there another possibility?
"and I am not of suche manner condicion" [[User:Cultures33|Cultures33]] ([[User talk:Cultures33|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Cultures33|contribs]]) 16:47, 17 July 2012 (UTC)

"The Lyrics of Wyatt: Poems or Songs?" ''The Review of English Studies'' 16.61 (1965): 1-13]], Jeff Dolven. "Reading Wyatt for the Style." ''Modern Philology'' 105.1 (2007): 65-86, Richard Leighton Greene. "Wyatt's 'I am as I am' in Carol-Form." ''Review of English Studies'' 15.58 (1964): 175-80, Lori Ann Garner. "Contexts of Interpretation in the Burdens of Middle English Carols." ''Neophilologus'' 84.3 (2000): 467-82, and Ray Siemens. "Henry VIII as Writer and Lyricist." ''Musical Quarterly'' 92.1-2 (2009): 136-66. [[User:Cultures4|Cultures4]] ([[User talk:Cultures4|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Cultures4|contribs]]) 19:22, 22 May 2012 (UTC)

page.title: Talk:The Devonshire Manuscript/I lowe lovyd and so doithe she

revision.comment: changed link to new HCMC scraper space
revision.text: == Contributors == To see a visualization of editor contributions to this page, click [http://hcmc.uvic.ca/~etcl/scraper/pages/I_lowe_lovyd_and_so__262465.htm here]. [[User:Cultures4|Cultures4]] ([[User talk:Cultures4|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Cultures4|contribs]]) 17:28, 8 May 2012 (UTC) == Context == The commentary for this poem would benefit from further description and critical context. See, for example, [[The_Devonshire_Manuscript/Works_Cited_N-Z#S|Ray Siemens et al. "Drawing Networks in the Devonshire Manuscript (BL Add 17492): Toward Visualizing a Writing Community's Shared Apprenticeship, Social Valuation, and Self-Validation". ''Digital Studies'' 1.1 (2009): n.p.]] [[User:Cultures4|Cultures4]] ([[User talk:Cultures4|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Cultures4|contribs]]) 18:23, 22 May 2012 (UTC) == Scribal error in line 22? == There is a crossover on the descender of p in "part." Could this be a scribal error, as no abbreviation seems to be indicated? "of all owr cares god send then part" [[User:Cultures33|Cultures33]] ([[User talk:Cultures33|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Cultures33|contribs]]) 18:05, 17 July 2012 (UTC)

page.title: Talk:The Devonshire Manuscript/It was my choyse It Was my chaunce

revision.comment: changed link to new HCMC scraper space
revision.text: == Contributors == To see a visualization of editor contributions to this page, click [http://hcmc.uvic.ca/~etcl/scraper/pages/It_was_my_choyse_It__262947.htm here]. [[User:Cultures4|Cultures4]] ([[User talk:Cultures4|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Cultures4|contribs]]) 17:32, 8 May 2012 (UTC) == Context == The commentary for this poem would benefit from further description and critical context. See, for example, [[The_Devonshire_Manuscript/Works_Cited_A-M#M|Winifred Maynard. "The Lyrics of Wyatt: Poems or Songs?" ''The Review of English Studies'' 16.61 (1965): 1-13]], DL Guss. "Wyatt's Petrarchism: An Instance of Creative Imitation in the Renaissance." ''Huntington Library Quarterly'' 29.1 (1965): 1-15, and Donald M. Friedman. "Wyatt and the Ambiguities of Fancy." ''Journal of English and Germanic Philology'' 67.1 (1968): 32-48. [[User:Cultures4|Cultures4]] ([[User talk:Cultures4|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Cultures4|contribs]]) 18:35, 22 May 2012 (UTC) == Supralinear 'en' in line 12? == Could the scribe have intended to write the 'en' as supralinear, thus denoting the abbreviation for 'then'? "may more prevayll yenryght ore myght" [[User:Cultures33|Cultures33]] ([[User talk:Cultures33|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Cultures33|contribs]]) 17:07, 17 July 2012 (UTC) == Possible scribal code? == If one assumes that the scribe uses an abbreviation sign in the words "powre," "lowre," "or," and "more" that consists of a raised hook following an n ({n'}=ne in the RET codes), does this preclude that a code was created ({r'}) to indicate an omitted e? i.e. line 13: "yf fortune then lyst for to lowre" [[User:Cultures33|Cultures33]] ([[User talk:Cultures33|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Cultures33|contribs]]) 17:12, 17 July 2012 (UTC)

page.title: Talk:The Devonshire Manuscript/Me list no more to sing

revision.comment: changed link to new HCMC scraper space
revision.text: == Contributors == To see a visualization of editor contributions to this page, click [http://hcmc.uvic.ca/~etcl/scraper/pages/Me_list_no_more_to_s_263863.htm here]. [[User:Cultures4|Cultures4]] ([[User talk:Cultures4|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Cultures4|contribs]]) 17:55, 8 May 2012 (UTC) == Context == The commentary for this poem would benefit from further description and critical context. See, for example, Barbara Odabashian. "Wyatt's me List no More to Sing." ''Explicator'' 50.4 (1992): 194-5. [[User:Cultures4|Cultures4]] ([[User talk:Cultures4|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Cultures4|contribs]]) 19:06, 22 May 2012 (UTC) == 'ye' on line 26 == On line 26-- "to gadre ye that ye maye"-- a misshapen 'y' crosses over letter 'e.' Is this the scribe's self-correction? [[User:Cultures33|Cultures33]] ([[User talk:Cultures33|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Cultures33|contribs]]) 16:54, 17 July 2012 (UTC) == Line 42 query == On line 42, the leading stroke of the 'v' appears to extend into the left margin. Is there another possibility? "vndrestonde me who lyste" [[User:Cultures33|Cultures33]] ([[User talk:Cultures33|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Cultures33|contribs]]) 16:57, 17 July 2012 (UTC)

revision.comment: changed link to new HCMC scraper space
revision.text:

[[User:Cultures4|Cultures4]] ([[User talk:Cultures4|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Cultures4|contribs]]) 18:09, 8 May 2012 (UTC) == 's+er' abbreviation in line 3 == Isn't the 's+er' abbreviation in line 3 unusual?
"love with vnkindenesse is causer of hevenis" [[User:Cultures33|Cultures33]] ([[User talk:Cultures33|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Cultures33|contribs]]) 16:36, 17 July 2012 (UTC) == Superscript 'r' in line 23 == In line 23, "this yis a sorye lyf to lyve alwaye in care," is the superscript 'r' an abbreviation? Or is it a needed character in a superscript position, as in the previous stanzas when the scribe writes the word 'or' in that manner? [[User:Cultures33|Cultures33]] ([[User talk:Cultures33|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Cultures33|contribs]]) 16:39, 17 July 2012 (UTC)

page.title: How To Succeed in College/Useful Software and Technology

revision.comment: Adding BookCat to uncategorised page
revision.text:
There are many useful software packages that can make your college years easier. Given the expense of college, the list below focuses on [[w:Free and Open Source Software|Free and Open Source Software (FOSS)]].
==Bibliography Management Software== In all likelihood you will need to write papers that include references. Different disciplines prefer different formats for references. Rather than create your bibliography by hand, you can use one of the following bibliography management software packages: *[[w:Zotero|Zotero]] http://www.zotero.org/ *[[w:Mendeley|Mendeley]] http://www.mendeley.com/ *[[w:LaTeX|LaTeX]] http://www.latex-project.org/
==Word Processing Software== For writing papers, you'll need word processing software. All of the software packages have software that functions as a word processing program: *[[w:LibreOffice_Writer|LibreOffice Writer]] http://www.libreoffice.org/ *[[w:OpenOffice.org_Writer|OpenOffice Writer]] http://openoffice.org/ *[[w:KWord|KWord]] http://www.koffice.org/kword/ *[[w:LyX|LyX]] http://www.lyx.org/ *[[w:AbiWord|AbiWord]] http://abisource.com/ *[[w:Google_Docs|Google Docs]] http://docs.google.com/
==Spreadsheet Software== Learning how to use and create spreadsheets is a useful skill to master in college. These packages include spreadsheet software: *[[w:LibreOffice_Calc|LibreOffice Writer]] http://www.libreoffice.org/ *[[w:OpenOffice.org_Calc|OpenOffice Calc]] http://openoffice.org/ *[[w:Google_Docs|Google Docs]] http://docs.google.com/
==Presentation Software== You may have to give a presentation in class. The following software packages include presentation software: *LibreOffice Impress http://www.libreoffice.org/ *[[w:OpenOffice.org_Impress|OpenOffice Impress]] http://openoffice.org/ *[[w:Google_Docs|Google Docs]] http://docs.google.com/
==Financial Management Software== For tracking your finances, you can use the following website: *[[w:Mint.com|Mint.com]] http://www.mint.com/
==Note Taking Software== If you prefer to take notes digitally, the following software can facilitate note taking: *[[w:Evernote|Evernote]] http://evernote.com/ {{BookCat}}

page.title: How To Succeed in College/Taking Notes

revision.comment: /* See also */
revision.text:
'''Notetaking''' is the practice of recording information captured from a transient source, such as an oral discussion at a meeting, or a lecture. Notes of a meeting are usually called minutes. The format of the initial record may often be informal and/or unstructured. One common format for such notes is shorthand, which can allow large amounts of information to be put on paper very quickly. Notes are frequently written in notebooks, though all sorts of paper may sometimes be used: for instance, some people like to use Post-It notes. Notetaking is an important skill for students, especially at the college level. Many different formats are used to structure information and make it easier to find and to understand later. Computers, particularly tablet computers, are beginning to see wide use as notetaking devices. In some contexts, such as college lectures, the main purpose of taking notes may be to implant the material in the mind; the written notes themselves are of secondary importance.
Professional notetakers provide access to information for people who cannot take their own notes, in particular the deaf and hearing impaired. Manual notetaking requires pen and paper, while Electronic Notetaking (or Computer-Assisted Notetaking) requires a laptop, often with special notetaking software. Professional Notetakers most frequently work in colleges and universities, but are also used in workplace meetings, appointments, conferences, and training sessions. They are usually educated to degree level. In the UK they are increasingly expected to have a professional notetaking qualification, such as that offered by the Council for the Advancement of Communication with Deaf People (CACDP).
==Systems== ===Charting=== Charting involves creating a graph with symbols, or a table with rows and columns. Graphs and flow-charts are useful for documenting a process or event. Tables are useful for facts and values.
===Outlining=== While notes can be written freely, many people structure their writing in an outline. A common system consists of headings that use Roman numerals, letters of the alphabet, and Arabic numerals at different levels. A typical structure would be:
:I. First main topic ::A. Subtopic :::1. Detail :::2. Detail ::B. Subtopic :II. Second main topic ::A. Subtopic
However, this sort of structure has limitations in written form since it is difficult to go back and insert more information. Adaptive systems are used for paper-and-pen insertions, such as using the reverse side of the preceding page in a spiral notebook to make insertions. Or one can simply leave large spaces in between items, to enable more material to be inserted. The above method is effective for most people, but this method can be creatively adapted for a user's specific needs.
===Mapping=== Here, ideas are written in a [[w:tree (graph theory)|tree structure]], with lines connecting them together. Mind maps are commonly drawn from a central point, with the purpose or goal in the center of the page; branches then extend outward to identify all the ideas connected to that goal. Colors, small graphics and symbols are often used to help to visualize the information more easily. This notetaking method is common among people who prefer a visual style of notetaking and is a core practice of many accelerated learning techniques. It is also used for planning and writing essays.
===Sentence method=== Every new thought is written as a new line. Speed is the most desirable attribute of this method because not much thought about formatting is needed to form the layout and create enough space for more notes. When taking these notes, they can be numbered or bulleted. This method can allow the reader to tell where a new thought ends and begins. This strategy is short and helpful, specially when a professor or teacher may need to read the notes.
===SQ3R=== SQ3R is a method of taking notes from written material, though it might be better classed as a method of reading and gaining understanding. Material is skimmed to produce a list of headings that are then converted into questions. These questions are then considered while the text is read to provide additional depth concerning what is being covered. Notes are written under sections headed by the questions as each of the material's sections is read. One then makes a summary from memory and reviews the notes.
===Guided Notes=== Sometimes lecturers may provide handouts of guided notes, which provide a "map" of the lecture content with key points or ideas missing. Students then fill in missing items as the lecture progresses. Guided notes may assist students in following lectures and identifying the most important ideas from a lecture. This format provides students with a framework, yet requires active listening (as opposed to providing copies of powerpoint slides in their entirety). Research has shown that guided notes improve students' recording of critical points in lecture as well as their quiz scores on related content.
==Electronic notetaking methods== The growing ubiquity of laptops in universities and colleges has led to a rise in [[w:Electronic Notetaking|electronic notetaking]]. Many students write their notes in word processors. Online word processor applications are receiving growing attention from students who can forward notes using email, or otherwise make use of collaborative features in these applications and can also download the texts as a file.
Online notetaking has created problems for teachers who must balance educational freedom with copyright and intellectual property concerns regarding course content.
==See also== {{wikibooks|Note Taking}}
{{BookCat}}
==References== * Van Matre, Nicholas H.; Carter, John (1975). [http://eric.ed.gov/ERICWebPortal/contentdelivery/servlet/ERICServlet?accno=ED103910 The Effects of Note-Taking and Review on Retention of Information]. Presented by Lecture. Paper presented at the Annual Meeting of the American Educational Research Association (Washington, D.C., March 30-April 4, 1975). * Carter, John F.; Van Matre, Nicholas H. (1975). [http://psycnet.apa.org/index.cfm?fa=search.displayRecord&uid=1976-06139-001 Note Taking Versus Note Having]. Journal of Educational Psychology, 67, 6, 900-4, Dec 75

page.title: How To Succeed in College/Classroom Behavior

revision.comment: Adding BookCat to uncategorised page
revision.text: More forthcoming, but for now: *arrive on time *do not pass notes *do not talk to other students while the professor is talking *respond to questions *be attentive and on task *ask about using a computer *ask about eating food {{BookCat}}

The commentary for this poem would benefit from further description and critical context. [[User:Cultures4|Cultures4]] ([[User talk:Cultures4|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Cultures4|contribs]]) 19:07, 22 May 2012 (UTC)
== Supralinear 'a' in line 14 ==
Does it appear as though the supralinear 'a' is placed over the 'u' instead of following the 's' in line 14?
[[User:Cultures33|Cultures33]] ([[User talk:Cultures33|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Cultures33|contribs]]) 16:28, 17 July 2012 (UTC)

revision.text:
{{Documentation subpage}} <!-- PLEASE ADD CATEGORIES AND INTERWIKIS AT THE BOTTOM OF THIS PAGE -->
This template is placed on a discussion page to request an edit of the corresponding [[Wikibooks:Protection policy|fully protected]] page. The template should be accompanied by a clear and specific description of the requested change, and consensus should be obtained before the template is added.
===Optional unnamed parameters=== #''Actual page.'' The actual page you want edited, such as when the talk page of the protected page is redirected. E.g. {{Tlx|Edit protected|Template:uw-vandalism}}. #''Category sort.'' E.g. {{Tlx|Edit protected|Template:Template Sandbox|Sandbox}}.
===See also=== *[[:Category:Protected edit requests]] - The category to which this template adds pages. <!-- DO NOT PLACE NEW REQUESTS HERE. Please read the instructions above which describe how to use the editprotected template. --> <includeonly> <!-- ADD CATEGORIES AND INTERWIKIS BELOW THIS LINE --> [[Category:Protection templates|{{PAGENAME}}]] </includeonly>
